Articles.Content:
I have visual studio

I have the source code

now what

i'm not good with this stuff

help

If the people who wrote it can't get it stable in 1.9 you probably can't either.

"now what" is you wait for them to release something, or stay on 1.8.1

Edited May 22, 2020 by Superfluous J

I have tried a compiled 1.9 version just for fun with texture packs like Spectra, without even touching a planet mod.

As the poster above me said, theres multiple reasons they have not released something the devs consider stable.

Unless you want to test something, chances are you will not enjoy it much.

Edited May 22, 2020 by hendrack
I can offer you no assistance, but I can move your question to the subforum where you're most likely to get help. And so I did. Good luck.

lol

hehe - you should stop asking.

 

for compiling: just get all dependencies (modular flight integrator), open the sln, change version in compatibilityChecker , relink references to ksp-files and rebuild

This is just a test, I don't plan on moving to 1.9 until it is officially released.

 

I don't know what to do with modular flight integrator. It's in my gamedata but I don't know where to put it. It didn't come in the kopernicus source code, and  it can't load kopernicus.parser. I don't know, but I think this is the issue. Once that is fixed, I have no idea where compatability checker is, and what I would do to the actual planet mod.

Edited May 22, 2020 by RP1IsSuperior

kopernicus parser can be found on github, when navigating to "external"
https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/tree/master/src/external

compatibilityChecker is a module in /constants directory

Edited May 23, 2020 by Speadge
